title: Paul Lynch wins Booker Prize for his dystopian novel 'Prophet Song'
description: The Irish writer won the prestigious literary award on Sunday with what judges called a 'soul-shattering' novel about a woman's struggle to protect her family as Ireland collapses into totalitarianism and war.

title: In Georgia, the independent spirit of cinema
description: In Tbilisi, young filmmakers are trying to preserve their freedom of expression, against a backdrop of geopolitical tension.

title: How Hamas became the leader of the Palestinian national movement
description: Initially focused on religion, Hamas then established itself on the Palestinian political scene, ousting its rival Fatah in Gaza – but since October 7, its military wing has been in control.

title: Verstappen ends  season in style with record-breaking victory in Abu Dhabi Grand Prix
description: The three-time world champion came home almost 18 seconds ahead of his nearest rival, Ferrari's Charles Leclerc, in Abu Dhabi on Sunday.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Fragile truce holds for third day of hostage and prisoner exchange
description: Seventeen hostages were handed over to the Red Cross on Sunday afternoon, including a 4-year-old American girl. Israel was to free 39 Palestinian prisoners later as part of the deal.

title: China says surge in respiratory illnesses is not caused by novel virus
description: In a statement on Sunday, the Chinese health ministry attributed the dramatic rise in respiratory illnesses to the flu and other known pathogens.

title: In Poland, the confessions of a fundamentalist Catholic who has turned virulent Church critic
description: In a major life U-turn, journalist Tomasz Terlikowski has made the fight against pedophilia within the Church his focus and is calling for change within the institution.

title: Sierra Leone under curfew after main military barracks attacked
description: Residents reported hearing gunshots at the barracks, which are close to the presidential residence.

title: Widow of French serial killer faces trial over her role in three murders
description: Monique Olivier is the wife of self-confessed French serial killer Michel Fourniret, a 65-year-old carpenter arrested in 2003 after an attempt to kidnap a 13-year-old girl.

title: TikTok: How influencers manipulate followers to increase their revenue
description: In staged showdowns between content creators, social media users – some very young – are encouraged to send virtual gifts purchased with real money. It's a practice that a number of French politicians would like to see better regulated.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Second group of hostages freed after tense day
description: Hamas delayed their release until the last moment, claiming that Israel was not fully respecting its commitments in the terms agreed for the truce. Eventually, 13 Israelis and four Thais were released on Saturday evening in exchange for 39 Palestinian prisoners.

title: Indonesia outraged over Israeli assault on Indonesian hospital in Gaza
description: Successive demonstrations and boycott campaigns supporting the Palestinians have prompted the Indonesian government to push for a ceasefire in Gaza.

title: Nuclear power: Divergent political perceptions in France and Germany
description: By its very nature, nuclear energy requires a strong state, which fits in well with France's Jacobin tradition. This is in contrast to Germany, a federal state, where nuclear energy symbolizes existential danger and the deprivation of citizens' rights.

title: Massive Russian drone attack on Kyiv: 'For a moment, I thought it was the end'
description: Several districts in the Ukrainian capital were hit by the strikes on Saturday. Kyiv fears that Moscow has now replenished its stockpiles and is preparing to strike on a large scale.
